results.title: Let's visit Darwin
results.creator_credit: Lex Halliday, Jean Halliday and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 19 of Series “Modern social studies”.
An instructional film for classroom use. Portrays Darwin as it is today (1957) - a vigorous expanding town and capital of the Northern Territory. A typical Darwin family is seen at daily tasks, and the way in which they spend their work and leisure hours is observed.

results.title: Let's visit Alice Springs
results.creator_credit: Lex Halliday, Jean Halliday and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 23 of Series “Modern social studies”.
Alice Springs and the people who live there, shops and amenities, electric power plant, artesian water supply, public services, airport, schools, hospital and flying doctor service. Includes visits to the Hermannsberg Mission, the Royal Flying Doctor Servie. Flynn’s Memorial Church and the School of the Air.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lex Halliday, Jean Halliday and Australian Instructional Films

results.title: Let's visit a cattle station
results.creator_credit: Lex Halliday, Jean Halliday and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 20 of Series “Modern social studies”.
An instructional film for classroom use. Tells of life on a Northern Territory cattle station. Isolation is the governing factor in the life of this and all other outback families - their daily routine involves tasks that must be done to ensure the functioning of the station as a self sufficient community. The children play their part by helping with mustering and branding - when they are not doing lessons by correspondence or school broadcasts.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lex Halliday, Jean Halliday and Australian Instructional Films

results.title: Let's try it (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: John Quick and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Science Curriculum Improvement Studies Series”.
Fifth grade children, working with the communities unit, observed crickets in their terraria and set up experiments to find out what the crickets eat. Later children observe frogs eating some of their crickets and so on. The children’s experiences provide background for the introduction of the concept of a community.

results.title: Let's talk cricket
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Alice Jackson Walsh
results.brief_description: Alice, a Gungarri Elder from Echuca, is the former president of the Campapse Cricket Association and Warma Indigenous Cricket Club. In this warm story she reminisces about her lifelong love affair with one of our national pastimes - and reveals its social importance and grass roots support by Australians.

results.title: Let's talk about women = Se permettete parliamo di donne = Parlons femmes
results.creator_credit: Mario Cecchi Gori, Concordia Film, Fair Film and Ettore Scola
results.brief_description: In this unusual Italian episodic comedy, Vittorio Gassman plays ten different characters, each of whom play out scenarios that humorously explore the absurd complications of love, marriage, adultery, sex and women. Each scenario - from picking up a prostitute to confronting a sister’s lover - contains a bizarre narrative twist. Beautifully presented in black and white, the film is like a cross between Fellini (in light hearted mode) and Jacques Tati as it trails Gassman’s protagonists around various Italian locations, depicting the frivolity of those living “la dolce vita”. Directorial debut for Ettore Scola, who would go on to collaborate with Gassman many times in their industrious careers. Fabulous jazzy score by Armando Trovajoli; cinematography by Sandro D’Eva. Cast includes: Donatello Mauro, Giovanna Ralli, Mario Lucidi, Antonella Lualdi, Sylva Koscina, Marco Tulli, Olga Romanelli, Heidi Stroh, Eleonora Rossi-Drago, Jean Valerie, and Edda Ferroao.

results.title: Let's talk about sex (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Talking to children about sex is often difficult but this informative program on human growth and development covers all aspects of sex. It is straightforward, relaxed and creates an atmosphere for frank, open discussion. It is easy to understand, descriptive and unbiased.

results.title: Let's Talk about It
results.brief_description: The first three programs in this series follow the experiences of an upper primary school class as they learn about human reproduction and sexuality. The final two programs discuss the experience with the teachers and parents.

results.title: Let's talk about films
results.brief_description: An approach-to-film discussion showing some of the problems encountered and how they may be overcome. A group of leaders tries to recognize the factors leading to successful film discussion by observing an audience actively discussing a familiar film. In retrospect one of the group recalls being unable to arouse any response whatever with the same film. Why did one effort fail and the other succeed? These questions are closely examined by the group leaders in a workshop meeting; the centering of discussion in the group rather than in the leader is seen to be an effective technique.
